column4: Anyone know what package i have to install to get PCMCIA wifi card working ?

not to sure, reading the manual atm
of course in the manual.. they only have the idiots guide to windows drivers installation
ok then put the cd in and fire up a termnial and change to the drive (usually somewhere in the /media folder) and the type in ls and pastebin the output
sec, just installed some packages on it, rebooted the lappy.
ok just do what i said just now
i got to see if it is broadcom-related card
its so short dont even need to pastebin it ----AUTOTUN.INF, Files, flashmain.swf, Manual, manual.open.exe, Other, start.exe
wow umm can you like pastebin the "files" folder then
yep did that before i rebooted
cant really pastebin, no network on that machine, what are you looking for ? i can just find it.
anything that says broadcom or bcm or anything like that
you might also have to look in the files too
nope nothing says BCM or BC
im gonna try and see if ndiswrapper works, not sure , never used ndiswrapper
and timewarner in my area cant access anything but google via web, so .. it weird
when you get back tell me if it's a laptop or desktop

goto the terminal and type in man ndiswrapper i can tell you how
crap umm you installed the inf file yet?
then on the terminal type in sudo modprobe ndiswrapper then sudo dhclient
i do it again and it just sits there
removed the ndiswrapper driver first though, gonna try a reboot then do the modprobe
ok it took the modprobe of ndiswrapper, but dhclient was not found
you might want to install that too

ok been researching get the ndiswrapper souce build it and then install it to your laptop's kernel
